title: ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code Code is quite big to be able to display inside the issue. I can upload to a repository if needed. Overview of what is happening in the code: - Create a zero size struct with a generic constant associated to compute at compile time a pointer to an embedded peripheral. - Create a wrapper around it to communicate with a device. This wrapper has some methods that return Result<[f32; 3], I::Error> where Error is the error type of the peripheral. - Inside this function an inner function is called with the signature: `fn write_to_address(6mut self, bytes: &[u8]) -> Result<(), I::Error>`, this is where the ICE is happening. ```Rust ``` `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.0-nightly (891ca5f63 2021-11-15) binary: rustc commit-hash: 891ca5f63c3b3cfe3939710a728671243e881ed6 commit-date: 2021-11-15 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_traits/src/normalize_erasing_regions.rs:54:32: could not fully normalize `core::result::Result<(), as embedded_hal::i2c::blocking::Write>::Error>` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1169:9 note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (891ca5f63 2021-11-15) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z trap-unreachable=no -C opt-level=3 -C panic=abort -C lto -C debuginfo=2 -C link-arg=--nmagic -C link-arg=-Tlink.x -C link-arg=-Tdefmt.x -C inline-threshold=5 -C no-vectorize-loops --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [normalize_generic_arg_after_erasing_regions] normalizing `core::result::Result<(), as embedded_hal::i2c::blocking::Write>::Error>` #1 [fn_abi_of_instance] computing call ABI of `micro_rp2040::peripherals::comm::i2c::blocking::master::eh::>::write` end of query stack ```
Backtrace
